{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Kasey Palmer | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Kasey Remel Palmer{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1996|11|9|df=y}} | birth_place = [[London Borough of Lewisham|Lewisham]], England | height = | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 45 | youthyears1 = 2005–2013 | youthclubs1 = [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] | youthyears2 = 2013–2016 | youthclubs2 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | years1 = 2016– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2016–2017 | clubs2 = → [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] (loan) | caps2 = 24 | goals2 = 4 | years3 = 2017–2018 | clubs3 = → [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] (loan) | caps3 = 4 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2018 | clubs4 = → [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] (loan) | caps4 = 15 | goals4 = 2 | years5 = 2018–2019 | clubs5 = → [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] (loan) | caps5 = 14 | goals5 = 1 | years6 = 2019– | clubs6 = → [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] (loan) | caps6 = 1 | goals6 = 1 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalyears2 = 2013 | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalcaps2 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2016 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 2 | nationalgoals3 = 2 | nationalyears4 = 2016– | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 6 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | club-update = 21:59, 12 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 19:41, 27 March 2018 (UTC) }} '''Kasey Remel Palmer''' (born 9 November 1996) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. He also plays for [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]]s. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Palmer joined [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] at the age of nine, and featured for the club for the majority of his youth career.{{Cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3524622/Kasey-Palmer-impressed-Chelsea-21s-nutmegged-Phil-Jones-youngster-looking-force-way-Guus-Hiddink-s-team-plans.html|title=Kasey Palmer impressed for Chelsea U 21s, but who is the youngster?|website=Mail Online|accessdate=19 April 2016}} Having represented his nation at youth level, Palmer attracted interest from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and made the move in March 2013. Due to their academy status, the Blues were able to sign Palmer for only a small compensation fee.{{Cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2306844/Kasey-Palmer-cost-Chelsea-800-000-Charlton-move.html|title=EXCLUSIVE: New-signing Palmer could cost Chelsea £800k after move from Charlton|website=Mail Online|accessdate=19 April 2016}} Making a handful of appearances for the [[Chelsea F.C. Reserves and Academy|Under-18s]] during the remainder of his inaugural season, Palmer became an influential figure in [[Adrian Viveash]]'s side for the 2013–14 while making sporadic appears from the bench for the [[Chelsea F.C. Reserves and Academy|Under-19s]] and [[Chelsea F.C. Reserves and Academy|Under-21s]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/development-squad/under-21s/u21-player-profiles/kasey-palmer.html|title=Kasey Palmer|website=www.chelseafc.com|accessdate=19 April 2016}} His first success came with the Under-21s, when he made appearances in the semi-final and final of the end-of-season playoffs before [[Dermot Drummy]]'s team were named league champions. He later featured as a substitute in every round of the club’s successful [[FA Youth Cup]] campaign while netting twice. He also played in all four [[UEFA Youth League]] knockout ties, while scoring against [[FC Zenit Saint Petersburg|Zenit St Petersburg]] in the second round before the Blues lifted the cup. The 2015–16 season also proved successful for Palmer, who scored three goals in five matches as they retained their crown.{{Cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11668/10248901/paris-saint-german-1-2-chelsea-blues-retain-uefa-youth-league-crown|title=Paris Saint-Germain 1–2 Chelsea: Blues retain UEFA Youth League crown|website=Sky Sports|accessdate=19 April 2016}} Tipped as one of the academy's most promising talents, Palmer signed a new contract in February 2016, which committed his future to the club until the end of the 2018–19 season.{{Cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BBS4DysNLUr/|title=Instagram photo by Kasey Palmer • Feb 2, 2016 at 7:03pm UTC|website=Instagram|accessdate=19 April 2016}} He was given his first taste of senior football under manager [[Guus Hiddink]], being named as an unused substitute against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] in April 2016.{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35949311|title=Swansea City 1–0 Chelsea|last=Stadium|first=Dafydd Pritchard BBC Wales Sport at the Liberty|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=19 April 2016}} ====Loan to Huddersfield Town==== On 15 July 2016, Palmer joined [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on a season-long [[Loan (sports)|loan]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.htafc.com/news/article/2016-17/huddersfield-town-kasey-palmer-chelsea-signing-transfer-loan-3187038.aspx|title=Chelsea’s Kasey Palmer joins Huddersfield Town on a season-loan Standard Loan|last=Threlfall-Sykes|first=David|accessdate=6 August 2016}} He made his professional debut on 6 August, replacing [[Jack Payne (footballer, born 1994)|Jack Payne]] in the 78th minute of a 2–1 win over [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]]. Palmer scored the winning goal after a minute on the pitch with just his second touch of the ball.{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36929750|title=Huddersfield Town 2–1 Brentford|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=6 August 2016}} In the following league game against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], Palmer once again came off the bench in the second-half, where he went on to set up Payne to score the winner with a through-ball to earn their second straight win.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36993966 |title=Jack Payne grabbed a late winner as Huddersfield maintained Newcastle's losing start to the new season |date=13 August 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport}} After an extended period out through injury, Palmer returned to action in the Championship play off final as Huddersfield won promotion to the Premier League.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/may/29/huddersfield-town-v-reading-championship-play-off-final-live|title=Huddersfield Town v Reading: Championship play-off final – as it happened|first=Barry|last=Glendenning|date=29 May 2017|publisher=|via=The Guardian}} On 3 July 2017, Palmer signed a contract extension with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] tying him to the club until 2021.{{Cite news |title=Kasey Palmer on Twitter |url=https://twitter.com/kaseypalmer45/status/881958927168090115 |publisher=Kasey Palmer (Twitter) |date=3 July 2017 |accessdate=3 July 2017}} A day later, Palmer's loan spell at [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] was extended for a further season.{{Cite news |title=Loan return for Palmer |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/loan-return-for-palmer.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=4 July 2017 |accessdate=4 July 2017}} On 2 January 2018, Palmer announced via [[Twitter]] that he would be leaving Huddersfield following the termination of his loan, after only featuring in five games all season.{{Cite news |title=Kasey Palmer on Twitter |url=https://twitter.com/kaseypalmer45/status/948294545560735745 |publisher=Kasey Palmer (Twitter) |date=2 January 2018 |accessdate=2 January 2018}} ====Loan to Derby County==== On 31 January 2018, Palmer joined Championship side [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] on loan for the remainder of the campaign.{{Cite news |title=Palmer loaned to Derby |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2018/01/palmer-loaned-to-derby.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=31 January 2018 |accessdate=31 January 2018}} He scored his first goal for Derby in a 2–2 draw against [[Leeds United]] on 21 February 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43053720 |title=Derby 2-2 Leeds |publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 February 2018|accessdate=21 February 2018}} ====Loan to Blackburn Rovers==== On 30 July 2018, Palmer joined Championship side [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on a season-long loan.{{cite web |title=Kasey Palmer: Blackburn Rovers sign Chelsea forward on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45011507 |work=BBC Sport |date=30 July 2018}} ====Loan to Bristol City==== In January 2019 he moved on loan to [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]].https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46811927 In his first game he came off of the bench to score on his debut in a 2-1 win against Bolton Wanderers.https://www.bcfc.co.uk/news/palmer-reflects-on-a-perfect-debut/ ==International career== Palmer made his debut for [[England national under-17 football team|England Under-17s]] on 8 February 2013, playing for seven minutes in a 2–1 defeat to [[Germany national under-17 football team|Germany]]. His second appearance came just two days later, when England suffered another 2–1 defeat, this time to [[Portugal national under-17 football team|Portugal]]. His final appearance for the Under-17s came later that week, when he came off the bench in a 1–0 defeat to the [[Netherlands national under-17 football team|Netherlands]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/under-21/2016/jun/kasey-palmer-toulon-reflections-020616|title=England U21s' Kasey Palmer reflects on dream season with Toulon Tournament title - England {{!}} The FA|last=Association|first=The Football|website=www.thefa.com|accessdate=7 August 2016}} He has also made a single appearance for [[England national under-18 football team|England Under-18s]] on 14 October 2013. Palmer played 73 minutes of a 4–0 win over [[Hungary national under-17 football team|Hungary]], which was his first international match played in his home country.{{Citation|last=England Football Official|title=England U18s vs Hungary 4-0 @ St. George's Park|date=14 October 2013|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=14xKbeb1pxQ|accessdate=7 August 2016}} After impressive displays for his club, Palmer received his first [[England national under-20 football team|Under-20]] call-up two and a half years after his previous international appearance. He played 45 minutes in a 2–1 defeat to [[Canada men's national under-20 soccer team|Canada]] on 27 March 2016, and marked his debut with his nation’s only goal of the game.{{Cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2016/mar/match-report-england-u20s-1-2-canada-u20s|title=England Under-20s beaten by Canada in Doncaster|website=www.thefa.com|accessdate=7 August 2016}} In May 2016, Palmer was part of the [[England national under-21 football team|England Under-21]] squad crowned champions of the [[2016 Toulon Tournament]].{{cite web |first=Nicholas |last=Veevers |title=England under-21s lift Toulon title after win over France |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/may/29/france-toulon-final-report-280516 |publisher=The Football Association |date=29 May 2016 |accessdate=17 December 2017}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 25 August 2018}}{{Soccerway|kasey-palmer/314424|accessdate=2 December 2017}} {| class="wikitable"
